column4: I am writing a bash script to copy drivers and install specific printers, is there a way to do a "dry run" run of the script to just see what output it will give?
I am writing a bash script to copy drivers and install specific printers, is there a way to do a "dry run" run of the script to just see what output it will give?
wouldn't it have to actually do it in order to see what happens? :-p
I guess that is true. I will just run it, it will be easy enough to undo
